intro: Polygala poaya var. minor, commonly known as the lesser poaya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woods. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. The species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
